title: SKINT WEEKEND
description: New film series at Metrograph (LES) featuring various films including 'Take a Walk on the Wild Side' and 'The Body Between Us'.

title: ADIFF Black History Month Film Series
description: The African Diaspora International Film Festival presents three days of screenings at Teachers College, Columbia University, showcasing untold black stories. $13 admission.
address: Teachers College, Columbia University, Morningside Heights

title: 6th Annual Black Women in Comedy Laff Fest
description: A festival featuring 24 shows over 5 days, celebrating black women in comedy. Various locations and prices, some events require a drink minimum.

title: 33rd Outsider Art Fair
description: The premier fair devoted to self-taught art, art brut, and outsider art returns to Metropolitan Pavilion (Chelsea) with more than 60 exhibitors from 40 cities across nine countries. $35 general admission, $25 senior + student tickets available at the door.

title: Tale Storytelling Show
description: An evening of performances by some of the city’s best storytellers, hosted by Harmon Leon. Half price with promo code ‘skintdiscount’ or mention the skint at the door (reg. $15), plus a two-drink minimum.
address: The Red Room at KGB Bar, East Village

title: Film on Tap: A Short Film Festival
description: Settle in for a night of suds and cinema at Bronx Brewery. Free admission.

title: The Parlor Reading Series
description: An interdisciplinary, community-based reading series hosts its winter 2025 edition at the Brooklyn Artery. Drinks will be available for purchase. Free (suggested donation $10).

title: Laugh It Off
description: A comedy show where audience members submit their everyday problems and comedians try to ‘fix’ them. $16 admission.

title: Sh*tty Mozart + Sh*tty Friends
description: A variety show and party with guest comedians and musicians at The Rat NYC. $10 admission.

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: A women-produced and-hosted comedy show with stand-up performances. Free admission (a tip jar will be passed around).

title: UCBlk: A Variety Show Spotlighting Black Performers
description: A night of improv, sketch, stand-up, music, and more featuring a dynamic lineup of black performers. $10 advance, $15 day of.
